availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jason Hamock (Caldwell County, KY, farmhand, pvt 48th ky inf.)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Willoughby Hamock and Jane Hamock. Resident of Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Princeton in 1860. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 26, 1863. Died of wounds received at Fort Boyce, Kentucky, on June 19, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 315A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 90.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0445.
